reviews.sentence: Fun for the New Year. Visited Harahs for New Years Eve. The party was popin and the food was delicious. The beds at Harahs are very comfortable. Looking forward to returning for Super Bowl weekend. On a sour note the restrooms in the self parking garage lobby is in need of better upkeep. It is very poorly maintained.

Harah s very nice but could be better. Harahs is an older casino and needs to update hotel rooms. Hotel rooms need new beds and carpeting. The mattresses are old and do not provide any support. Carpets have been around for a while and are worn down.

No hot water. My stay was a bit disappointing as I did not have any hot water coming out of the shower. I called at about 10 pm for maintenance and by 130 there was still no word or Eta. I called back again because I had plans to meet up with friends and could nt stay in the room much longer and they told me the maintenance person had 2 rooms ahead of me. I told them I could not wait but to instruct the maintenance man to come into my room even if I was not there so I could have hot water in the morning at least. I get back to the room at 4 am and test the water in the shower. it is STILL cold. Very disappointing. so I call for maintenance 3rd time now. and they said someone will be on the way. I had think at 4 am that it would not be anyone ahead of me but I did not get a knock on my door from the maintenance guy for another hour and a half to 2 hours. The maintenance person was nice and after about 35 mins fixed the problem but it really was not a great overall experience. I have stayed at Harahs a lot and this was the first time I was disappointed.

Not conference friendly. I will only review the hotel from a business point of view. Our company had a national meeting there with about 400 attendees. It is my expectation of a hotel hosting conventions to be able to provide the necessary services. The internet service at this hotel is totally unacceptable. I was never able to get service in my room even after repeated attempts to deal with their hot line support. They created three different tickets but I received no help. Well actually I had a knock on my door at 1230 one night and it was from maintenance saying they would fix my tv which was working. The front desk at the hotel is way understaffed and this causes big back ups in waiting times. In general the rooms need updating. Again it might be good for gambling but certainly not for business.

I stayed at the Harahs Casino on 328 with a check out of 329. During my stay I slipped and fell due to a leaking pipe under the sink in my bathroom of my hotel room. I reported this to the casino and a incident report was completed. I also went to the ER that day due to the pain in my back from hitting the tile during my fall. I have had to go to the chiropractor 3 days a week since and still have tingling in my fingers and now have to have mris and go to a orthopedic due to the injuries I sustained. My spine curves to the right due to the impact of my fall. Harahs liability company deemed them not negligent due to the fact that it had not been previously reported. I have to out of pocket costs for the rest of my life with no compensation due to the fact that Harahs does not take responsibility for negligence in their hotel. The liability company clearly told me that plumbing repair work had to be done due to the fact that the pipe was leaking and that they did have to repair that issue but because it was not previously reported my injuries do not matter. I should of known the outcome would not be good considering management was not even willing to comp my room or food during my stay after such a horrible experience. I am currently on a long journey of finding an attorney to resolve this matter.

Overnight getaway. The casino was a great experience. The casino was beautiful and all the workers were very nice and the casino was clean and well runed. Our room was in the marina section was very old and needed to be updated. The wall paper in the bedroom was hanging off and their was dust bunnies all around the room door the furniture was falling apart and very old nod the floor was also dirty and all scuffed up. The bathroom shower walls had hair all over the walls and the toilet was wet when we checked in and under the sink was all rust stains and around the outside of the tub was also in bad shape. Also one of the towels given to us was dirty. We were disappointed in the room but thank God the casino was good.

Overall we stayed for one night and then left and booked BALYs much bigger room same price. facilities were very nice and restaurants were excellent staff very accommodating. Room was outdated and we had trouble not once but twice having to GO ALL THE WAY BACK to front desk to get new room key. After 2nd time my key did not work I had security let me in and then front desk sent up locksmith to repair entrance card key. we received new card keys and they worked fine. but overall was a complete pain in the ass. Also one of the servers drinks was very rude to the people at the card table complaining this was not her area and took 15 min to get a drink. We ended up going to bar to get our service.

Very Mediocre. The best thing about our stay was the pool and spa at Harahs. The rooms need some cleaning and updating since it was the most deplorable condition however after dinner and gambiling and returning very very late it was too late to switch or we would have demanded it.

Nice getaway. The accessibility to the casinos. The staff were all great. The waiters bartenders dealers bell captains etc were all excelentAte breakfast at Samys and our waitress was great but the food took FOREVER to come out. Then we waited 15 minutes to pay for the food because there was such a long line at the counter to pay. The room could have used some repairs and the shower was cold.

We had a great time at this beautiful fun hotel. Check in was a great experience very friendly staff. We were upgraded at no cost to the Waterfront Tower and had a fantastic view. The slots were fun and we even won a bit. The restaurants were very good and the buffet was great. it is a bit expensive if you do not have comps. but well worth it. The pool was being renovated but we had no intention of swimming anyway so that was not an issue. Overall a great place to stay while in AC.

Love visiting Harahs. The rooms are spacious and clean. They have all sorts of amenities available if you are interested. There are great places to eat and the buffet is great. There is a newly renovated club The Pool for nightlife and of course all the slot machines and tables you could ask for.

Love the newly renovated section. We had a wonderful stay the rooms were large clean new with a modern contemporary look. We were on the 17th floor and had a great view of the city but mostly marshland. We are looking forward to going back in September.

Renovation success. The hotel is definitely experiencing a make over. The common areas are being kept much better and much cleaner. The renovated room was done tastefully and was being kept clean. There seemed to be more of a family atmosphere.

A Sunday night at Harah ’s. Our room was newly renovated and looked clean and fresh. We went down to the pool to relax and have a few cocktails. Seating was very limited. There appeared to be a large number of empty lounge chairs that were tagged as reserved. We had to walk up to the bar and place our drink order twice as there did not appear to be anyone taking drink orders.

Long Overdue Girls Trip. Newly renovated clean room super friendly staff willing to put up with your silly questions and an all inclusive spa onsite. what else do you need when you are getting away from the daily grind with your girlfriends. Um a late night pool bar. and they have that too.

Three night stay in renovated Bay View Tower. I recently stayed at Harahs for three nights and checked in on a Sunday. Check in was miserable as at 4 pm there were hundreds of people checking in and it took almost an hour to check in. They had kiosks they encourage you to use to check in with staff saying it is faster however some do not work and they would not accept my RI drivers license so I had to check in the traditional way. The line actually moved pretty quick as all hands were on deck at the counter with every computer screen staffed which was nice. I was given room 605 in the Bayview Tower which was renovated last year but I had to wait to get my room keys. They said my room was not ready and oddly housekeepers clean from bottom to top in that tower so I was restricted to 6th floor unles I wanted to wait even longer and since it was already 5 pm I wanted to get settled in quick. I still had to wait an hour and a half they never texted to say my room was ready and I went to desk to inquire and suddenly my room was ready. That was annoying. I had love to someday get a higher floor room at Harahs. I still had a decent partial Ocean View and AC skyline GNThe room itself was nicely renovated loved the colors and design and overall the room was large and comfortable. Housekeeping did a lousy job cleaning however as the room was not vacuumed and there are drink and other stains throughout the room. Dust in the beautiful lamps by the beds too. Some of the lights were already starting to break as one would fall over if you lightly touched it. I liked how there were USB plugs and lots of outlets. The bathroom was spacious with a separate soaking tub which was large and relaxing and fills fast. Despite the room only being redone last year or so Some of the furniture is RUSTING including the small table by the lounger seat near window which left rust stains on the carpeting. The bathroom counter unit also was rusty all the chrome metal trim along the bottom was rusty next to where they put the towels which is a shame. I also did not like the faucet handles due to very sharp corners. Two of the three nights were comped and I feel like the rate was great for a three day stay and would stay at Harahs again. While I prefer to stay at Caesars when they are too expensive Harahs is my go to. Did pretty good on slots at times but just so so on table games. Some of the table game staff like on three card poker were kind of odd. I also ate at the cafe place with the nice ice cream near lobby however my cakebater ice cream tasted weird and not like it was expected to taste like. Food is pricey at most of the places at Harahs.

Harah ’s AC shines. Once again Harahs did not disappoint. This trip per request we stayed in the newly renovated Coastal Tower and found it to be clean and pleasant. Staff at Harahs have remained consistently courteous and assist with a smile.

3rd visit rooms are still a hit or miss. Not as great of a time as my first 2nd and 3rd time had to move rooms due poor housekeeping. Appears the housekeeping staff is understaffed and or overworked. Rooms otherwise especially the newly renovated ones are very nice and roomy. I do wish there were microwaves so one is not held hostage to eat via the eateries but at least with a fridge leftovers are refrigerated till it is time to head home if not too far away.

Overall experience. Our Room was ok. needs a makeover but met out needs for our stay The pool was beautiful and fun. The Buffet was good however breakfast. was not so good so we left and went to the coffee shop. Customer service could use work.

Needs Major Renovation. My husband and I stayed one night in the Marina Tower and were glad it was not more. The reservation said “ Marina View ”. We had a view of the roof an exhaust pipe and the parking garage. They tried to charge us for early check in and the room was dirty and dated. Evidently Harah ’s now allows pets in the hotel. There was a lingering smell of urine and dogs throughout the hallways and room. You can hear dogs barking that have been left in their rooms by their owners. We tried to address the issues with the front desk staff. They were not very helpful and were argumentative at times. They comped my husband 25. That did n’t even cover the cost of the resort fee. This was a horrible experience. The hotel itself and staff are both in need of repair. We will not be back.
